name: Grevillea
description: Grevillea is a genus of about 350 species of flowering plants in the Proteaceae family, primarily native to Australia.These shrubs or trees are highly valued for their exotically shaped, vividly colored and nectar-rich flowers. Their flowerheads, which open at varying times, are composed of many small flowers that come in a wide range of colors. These unique evergreen plants come in all shapes and sizes and have an extremely long season of bloom. Theyâ€™re also an excellent choice if you want to attract wildlife to your garden.
meaning: The genus was named in honor of British antiquarian, collector and politician Charles Francis Greville (1749-1809).
color_description: Grevillea flowers may be red, yellow, orange, purple or white, depending on species.
